page.title: 03ECOLOGY, BLEASDALE
page.content:
Most of the area is owned by Bleasdale Tower Estate and is used for shooting. The gamekeeper rears pheasants. When boys are 13 years old they can go beating and can earn Â£9 a day.
There is a lot of wildlife around Bleasdale.The largest mammals we have seen are deer.There are many grey squirrels,rabbits,hares,stoats and weasels.
There are a great many different species of birds but strangely there are no sparrows.Sometimes ornithologists come here to study and take pictures of the birds.
In the springtime the woods are blue with bluebells and many flowers can be found in meadows through the summer.
